intro: Acantholimon latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it well-suited for coastal environments.
